Annotation.String: Chassis location in relation to it’s parent.
Chassis location in relation to it’s parent.
This indicate if Rack Management Module is present in Rack chassis.
This indicate if Rack Management Module is present in Rack chassis.
This indicate if Rack chassis support disaggregated power and cooling feature.
This indicate if Rack chassis support disaggregated power and cooling feature.
Universal Unique Identifier for this resource.
Universal Unique Identifier for this resource.
String containing geographical identification metadata.
String containing geographical identification metadata. Usually consist of latitude and longitude.
String containing physical location ID of this chassis.
String containing physical location ID of this chassis.
String containing physical location ID of parent chassis.
String containing physical location ID of parent chassis.
This property is an array of IDs of cable or cables connected to this port.
This property shall contain an array of string identifying cable(s) connected to this port. This is crucial for topology discovery.
This indicates array of PCI devices present in computer system.
This indicates array of PCI devices present in computer system
This indicates computer system discovery state.
This property shall represent discovery state of this interface
This indicates number of processor sockets available in system.
This indicates number of memory sockets available in system
This indicates number of memory sockets available in system.
This indicates number of memory sockets available in system
This indicates if platform user mode is enabled.
This property shall represent current platform mode. When enabled update of FW components should be blocked on in-band interfaces.
This indicates if TXT mode is enabled.
This property shall represent current Trusted Execution Technology state.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this ComputerSystem.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this ComputerSystem.
This indicates current voltage of memory module.
This property shall represent current voltage of memory module
Temperature of the Memory resource.
The value of this property shall be temperature of the Memory resource in Celsius.
Memory Bandwidth in Percent.
The value of this property shall be Memory Utilization on specific Memory module in Percent.
The percentage of memory cycles that were throttled due to power limiting.
The value of this property shall be the percentage of memory cycles that were throttled due to power limiting.
Power consumed by Memory domain resource.
The value of this property shall be global power for specific Memory module (e.g. DIMM) in Watts.
Memory Thermal Margin in degree Celsius.
The value of this property shall be a difference between current memory module temperature and optimal temperature for the module in degree Celsius.
Number of ECC Errors found on this Memory module.

The value of this property shall be a number of ECC Errors found on this Memory module. It's up to implementer if only UnCorrectable or both Correctable and Uncorrectable errors are shown per Module resource.
Memory module Health as a discrete sensor reading
The value of this property shall be Memory module Health as a discrete sensor reading.
This action is used to trigger Deep Discovery.
This action is used to trigger Pod Manager Deep Discovery mechanism.
Required device state after action is finished.
This defines the TPM device state as a result of triggering this action.
Required interface type of the Trusted Module.
This defines the interface type of the installed Trusted Module device as a result of triggering this action.
This indicates if TPM ownership should be cleared.
This defines if Trusted Module ownership should be cleared as a result of triggering this action.
This action is used to change TPM state and version.
This action is used to change TPM state and version.
This indicates ethernet port which is connected to this interface
This property shall represent the URI of ethernet port connected to this interface
This indicates all supported protocol types.
This property shall represent an array of supported protocol types by the Ethernet interface.
This indicates processor brand.
This property shall represent the brand of processor.
This indicates array of processor capabilities.
This property shall represent array of processor capabilities (like reported in /proc/cpuinfo flags)
An array of references to the endpoints that connect to this processor.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this processor is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Endpoint.
Thermal Design Power (TDP) of this processor.
Thermal Design Power (TDP) of this processor.
FPGA specific properties for FPGA ProcessorType.
For FPGA ProcessorType this property will expose specific data.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Processor.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Processor.
Extended contents of the Identification Registers (CPUID) for this processor.
This property shall include the extended raw CPUID instruction output for (that is for all possible combinations of input registers) as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
Xeon E3 CPU family.
Xeon E5 CPU family.
Xeon E7 CPU family.
uServer X3 CPU family.
uServer X5 CPU family.
uServer X7 CPU family.
Core i3 CPU family.
Core i5 CPU family.
Core i7 CPU family.
Xeon Silver CPU family.
Xeon Gold CPU family.
Xeon Platinum CPU family.
Type of memory.
Type of memory.
Memory capacity.
Memory capacity.
Memory speed.
Memory speed.
On die processor memory.
FPGA type.
FPGA type.
Version of BitStream loaded on FPGA.
Version of BitStream loaded on FPGA.
High Speed Serial Interface configuration.
High Speed Serial Interface configuration.
High Speed Serial Interface sideband interface type.
High Speed Serial Interface sideband interface type.
Number of supported reconfiguration slots.
Number of supported reconfiguration slots.
FPGA properties.
The contents of the Identification Registers (CPUID) for this processor for specific combination of input registers.
This property shall include the raw CPUID instruction output as provided by the manufacturer of this processor for specific combination of input registers.
Version of Rack Scale Design API exposed by this service.
Version of Intel® RSD API exposed by this service.
This is a link to a collection Ethernet Switches.
The classes' structure shall only contain a reference to a resource that complies to the EthernetSwitch schema.
This is a link to a collection of Nodes.
This object shall only contain a reference to a collection of resources that comply to the Nodes schema.
This indicates if VLAN is tagged (as defined in IEEE 802.1Q).
This indicates if VLAN is tagged (as defined in IEEE 802.1Q).
This indicates neighbor port which is connected to this port.
This property shall represent the URI of port connected to this port
This indicates if drive should be erased when detached from PCI switch.
This property shall represent the state of policy for protecting data stored on drive connected to PCI switch. If set to null it is interpreted as it would be set to true.
This indicates whether drive was cleared after assignment to composed node.
This property shall represent the erase state of drive.
This indicates drive firmware version.
This indicates drive firmware version.
A reference to the storage controller where this drive is connected.
A reference to the storage controller where this drive is connected.
A reference to the PCIe function that provides this drive functionality.
A reference to the PCIe function that provides this drive functionality.
An array of references to the storage pools using the drive.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this drive is associated with and shall reference a resource of type storage pool.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Drive.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Drive.
An array of references to the ethernet switches located in this Chassis.
The value of this property shall reference one or more resources of type EthernetSwitch that are in this Chassis.
An array of references to the PCIe connection identifiers (e.g. cable ID).
An array of references to the PCIe connection identifiers (e.g. cable ID).
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Port.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Port.
Extended Power resource.
Extended Power resource.
Additional actions for Power resource.
Additional actions for Power resource.
The global power level on AC side in Watts.
The value of this property shall represent the global power level on AC side in Watts, requires platform instrumentation to get reports of AC power.
This is the requested state of PSU.
This property defines requested state of Power Supply to be changed to.
This is the identifier for the Power Supply within the PowerSupplies collection.
This is the identifier for the Power Supply within the PowerSupplies collection.
This action is used to change state of Power Supply.
This action is used to change state of Power Supply.
Extended Thermal resource.
Extended Thermal resource.
Volumetric Air Flow measured in Cubic Feet per Minute.
The value of this property shall be Volumetric Air Flow measured in Cubic Feet per Minute. This metric requires Inlet and Outlet temperature sensor readings
This property represent desired speed of all FANs in current chassis as percentage of max speed.
This property represents desired speed of all FANs in current chassis as percentage of maximum fan speed.
This property specifies the precision of a calculated metric (calculated metric shall be aligned to a value specified by This property .
The value of the property shall specify the precision of a calculated metric (calculated metric shall be aligned to a value specified by this property)
This array property specifies possible values of a discrete metric.

The values of the property shall specify type of the discrete metric. It specifies whether single or multiple values defined in DiscreteValues array are valid for specific metric, metric property shall be defined accordingly. This property shall be defined only when the MetricType property has the value 'Discrete'.
The type of Discrete Metric reading.
The value shall indicate the type of Discrete Metric reading.
Single entry from DiscreteValues array is allowed as Discrete Metric Reading.
Multiple entries from DiscreteValues array is allowed as Discrete Metric Reading.
An array of references to the endpoints that connect to this volume.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this volume is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Endpoint.
Collection of managers managing the service.
Collection of managers managing the service.
Endpoint authentication.
This property provides information about endpoint authentication required credentials.
Endpoint authentication credentials.
Endpoint username.
This property provides an endpoint username that is used to authenticate it on other side of communication channel.
Endpoint password.
This property is used to provide an endpoint password. It provides write only access. On read, it shall return null value.
Determines if volume is bootable.
This property provides information about the bootable capability of the volume.
This indicates if volume should be erased when detached from initiator host.
This property shall represent the state of policy for protecting data stored on a drive connected to an initiator host. If set to null, it is interpreted as true.
This indicates whether volume was cleared after assignment to composed node.
This property shall be set to true if the volume was erased.
A reference to the Metrics associated with this Volume
A reference to the metrics associated with this volume.
An array of references to the Zone resources containing this endpoint.
The value of the property is a reference to the resources that the endpoint is associated with and references a resource of type Zone.
Specifies the interfaces on which this transport is available.
This property is an array of references to resources representing interface where this endpoint is available.
